briefdescription.para: Run free, without waiting for edge triggers.
Trigger on a rising edge.
Trigger on a falling edge.
Resend the last acquired data.
Values supported by the Command attribute of the Settings characteristic.
Make device idle.
Measure DC voltage.
Measure AC voltage.
Measure DC current.
Measure AC current.
Values supported by the Mode attribute of the Settings and Metadata characteristics.
Sampling has completed.
Actively sampling.
An error has occurred.
Values supported by the Status attribute of the Metadata characteristic.
Raw samples from the Reading characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: These raw samples are (supposedly) wihtin the range -2048 to +2047, and need to be multiplied by the Metadata::scale value from the Metadata characteristc to get the true values.

Also supposedly, there should be no more than 10 samples at a time, according to Pokit's current API docs. There is not artificial limitation imposed by QtPokit, so devices may begin batching more samples in future.

briefdescription.para: UUID of the "DSO" service.
Returns mode as a user-friendly string.

memberdef.argsstring: (const PokitProduct product, const quint8 range, const Mode mode)
memberdef.name: toString

briefdescription.para: Returns range as a user-friendly string, or a null QString if mode has no ranges.

memberdef.argsstring: (const PokitProduct product, const quint8 range, const Mode mode)
memberdef.name: maxValue

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum value for range, or the string "Auto".

detaileddescription.para: If range is not a known valid enumeration value for product's mode, then a null QVariant is returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (const quint8 range, const Mode mode) const
memberdef.name: toString

briefdescription.para: Returns range as a user-friendly string, or a null QString if mode has no ranges.

memberdef.argsstring: (const quint8 range, const Mode mode) const
memberdef.name: maxValue

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum value for range, or the string "Auto".

detaileddescription.para: If range is not a known valid enumeration value for the current product's mode, then a null QVariant is returned.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new Pokit service with parent.
Destroys this DsoService object.
Read all characteristics.

detaileddescription.para: This convenience function will queue refresh requests of all characteristics supported by this service.
Relevant *Service::*Read signals will be emitted by derived class objects as each characteristic is successfully read.

briefdescription.para: Reads the DSO service's Metadata characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the read request is succesfully queued, false otherwise (ie if the underlying controller it not yet connected to the Pokit device, or the device's services have not yet been discovered).
Emits metadataRead() if/when the characteristic has been read successfully.

briefdescription.para: Configures the Pokit device's DSO mode.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the write request was successfully queued, false otherwise.
Emits settingsWritten() if/when the settings have been writtem successfully.

briefdescription.para: Start the DSO with settings.

detaileddescription.para: This is just a synonym for setSettings() except makes the caller's intention more explicit, and sanity-checks that the settings's command is not DsoService::Command::ResendData.

briefdescription.para: Fetch DSO samples.

detaileddescription.para: This is just a convenience function equivalent to calling setSettings() with the command set to DsoService::Command::Refresh.

Once the Pokit device has processed this request succesffully, the device will begin notifying the Metadata and Reading characteristic, resulting in emits of metadataRead and samplesRead respectively.

briefdescription.para: Returns the most recent value of the DSO service's Metadata characteristic.

detaileddescription.para: The returned value, if any, is from the underlying Bluetooth stack's cache. If no such value is currently available (ie the serviceDetailsDiscovered signal has not been emitted yet), then the returned DsoService::Metadata::scale member will be a quiet NaN, which can be checked like:

briefdescription.para: Enables client-side notifications of DSO metadata changes.

detaileddescription.para: This is an alternative to manually requesting individual reads via readMetadataCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.
Successfully read values (if any) will be emitted via the metadataRead() signal.

briefdescription.para: Disables client-side notifications of DSO metadata changes.

detaileddescription.para: Instantaneous reads can still be fetched by readMetadataCharacteristic().
Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Enables client-side notifications of DSO readings.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.
Successfully read samples (if any) will be emitted via the samplesRead() signal.

briefdescription.para: Disables client-side notifications of DSO readings.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true is the request was successfully submited to the device queue, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: This signal is emitted when the Settings characteristic has been written successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Metadata characteristic has been read successfully.
This signal is emitted when the Reading characteristic has been notified.
Constructs a new Pokit service with parent, and private implementation d.
The DsoService class accesses the DSO (Digital Storage Oscilloscope) service of Pokit devices.
